instruction: How was the Autoregressive locally optimized successive projection algorithm (ALO-SPA) combined with recurrent neural network (RNN) in the research on using hyperspectral imaging technology combined with deep learning methods to identify the seed viability of Sophora japonica?
Output:
In the research, the Autoregressive locally optimized successive projection algorithm (ALO-SPA) was combined with the recurrent neural network (RNN) to improve the detection and prediction of seed viability in Sophora japonica using hyperspectral imaging technology and deep learning methods. The ALO-SPA algorithm was proposed as an improvement on the original successive projection algorithm (SPA). 

The ALO-SPA algorithm was then compared with three typical algorithms. When combined with RNN, the ALO-SPA algorithm showed the best performance in identifying seed viability. This combination of ALO-SPA and RNN formed the detection model, which was able to accurately distinguish between high-viability, low-viability, and non-viability seeds after simulating natural aging.

Furthermore, based on this detection model, the researchers established a vitality prediction model using the data of swelling at 0 hours. The effectiveness of this vitality prediction model was found to be better than that of the detection model. Overall, the combination of hyperspectral imaging, deep learning methods, ALO-SPA, and RNN allowed for more accurate prediction of the seed viability of Sophora japonica.
